nodes.description: Arika Airlines Boeing 757-300 reports missiles fired at it as it takes off from Mombassa en route for Tel Aviv.
Two unused Sam 7 missiles are recovered from the scene where missiles were reported to have been fired at the plane.
A green Pajera jeep carrying suicide bombers crashes through the gates of the Israeli-owned Paradise Hotel in Mombassa, Kenya, and explodes in the lobby.
The November 28 bombing of the Paradise Hotel kills 16 people, including three Israelis and ten Kenyan hotel employees.
An unknown organization calling itself the Army of Palestine claims responsibility for the Kenyan attacks.
Israeli and US investigators blame Al Ittihad al Islamiya (AIAI), a Somali-based organization with links to Al Qaeda, for the attacks.
A gun attack on a Likud party office in Beit Sheân, Israel kills six people and wounds 43, with the Al Aksa Martyrs’ Brigade claiming responsibility.
The Mombassa bombing coincides with the gun attack on the Likud party office and provides a justification for extending the US-led 'war against terrorism'.
